definition: A legal order issued by a court to help protect a survivor from abuse, harm, or harassment.
Victims of Crime Act, a federal law that funds victim services in Texas and other states.
Battering Intervention & Prevention Program, designed to hold those who cause harm accountable and support change.
Violence Against Women Act, a federal law to protect and support survivors of domestic and sexual violence.
Child Protective Services, a government agency that investigates child abuse or neglect.
